item.title: [JDK-8283214] [macos] Screen magnifier does not show the magnified text for JComboBox
item.description:
I have a JFrame with JLabel and JComboBox. I was trying Screen magnifier on macOS.
I enabled Hover Text in Zoom section in Accessibility settings of macOS. I see that native combo box shows large-text view of the item under the pointer but JComboBox doesn't.

Steps to reproduce
--------------------------
1) Enable Screen magnifier on Mac
System Preferences -> Accessibility -> Zoom -> Select (Enable Hover Text)
2) Run the attached code by passing the following option
 -Djavax.accessibility.screen_magnifier_present=true JComboBoxScreenMagnifierBug.java

3) Once the JFrame is visible, press the Command (Cmd) key and move mouse over JLabel (Fruits), you should see "Fruits" with magnified or enlarged text.
4) Move the mouse pointer over JComboBox. If you don't see the magnified text, then the bug is reproduced.



Note: I am getting the following exception in JDK 17 b35, but it's not reproduced in JDK 18 b36 and JDK 19 b13. This exception is seen when user presses the Command key and moves the mouse pointer over a Swing component

[~abhiscxk] These two aren't fixed yet, so their subject can also be amended to reflect the problem better. Both are submitted by [~landrews].

I'm not an experienced user of macOS, I don't know how regular users, especially those who use the feature, refer to it. If the most common name for it is "Screen magnifier", we should stick to it. It would help others who search for similar issues.

It could be that I simply interpolate my experience with Windows to macOS, this is where my confusion comes from. Users of macOS might not have this at all because "Screen magnifier" means exactly the described thing: Enlarge text on hover while holding Command button.

In short, my concern is to be precise and to use the most commonly used term to refer to this particular feature… in this bug and in others.
[~aivanov] Yes. Few of them are JDK-8283887, JDK-8284104.
[~abhiscxk] Are those issues about this Text Enlarge on Hover feature?

[~aivanov] I agree with you the feature is about the "Text Enlarge" instead of part of screen getting magnified but I can find there are many bugs with the subject as "Screen Magnifier". Although I don't have any issue with changing the subject but I guess "Screen Magnifier" is most commonly used keyword for a11y area. Keeping it same should be ok.

When I saw “Screen Magnifier” in the subject, I assumed it was like screen magnifier works in Windows by simply scaling up parts of the screen. However, this macOS feature is different from that. It's available in Accessibility > Zoom > Hover Text. Apple calls the feature “Hover Text” [1].

Shall we update the subject of the bug to reference the name of the feature as Apple refers to it, or Zoom on Hover Text? It could be less misleading, since “magnifier” could be thought about scaling up portions of the screen but it's not what's happening.

https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/mac-help/mchlb203bc78/mac
